data.note: The national utility Nepal Electricity Authority (NEA) has a monopoly on transmission and distribution, and dominates generation too. However, the number of independent power producers (IPPs) involved in hydro generation is increasing.
data.name: The power sector has been unbundled (whether privatized or not) into distinct actors for generation, transmission, distribution and retail

data.note: The power system is run by the NEA, a vertically-integrated state-owned utility.
data.name: There are legally separate private companies at each segment of the power system pre-retail

data.note: Transmission is conducted by state-owned utility, the NEA.
data.name: There is an independent transmission system that dispatches according to market dynamics and is not susceptible to state interference

data.note: The utility subsidises retail power prices, and as a consequence operates at a loss that has averaged NPR 5bn ($46.6m) per year for the last 10 years.
data.name: Retail electricity prices aren't distorted by subsidies

data.note: The national utility is to freeze new power purchase agreements (PPAs) for hydro plants, according to reports, having contracted enough additional capacity to meet its targets.
data.name: There aren't significant barriers to private sector participation in generation

data.note: There is no power market as such. The national utility is the only distributor and consumers do not have a choice of supplier.
data.name: Consumers can choose retail suppliers or third-party power marketers in the retail power market

data.note: There is no power market as such, and all tariffs are regulated.
data.name: There is a functioning competitive wholesale generation market

data.note: The NEA owns and operates the large share of generation. There are several hydro IPPs, but their projects tend to be small.
data.name: The generation market has many different actors and is not concentrated in the hands of a few players

data.note: The NEA has a monopoly on distribution and supply. In practice, rural small hydro mini-grids are operated by local cooperatives.
data.name: The supply market has many different actors and is not concentrated in the hands of a few players
